<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 593, 861, 612]]<|/det|>
A sequence of diagrams is formed by drawing equilateral triangles each of side one centimetre.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 609, 435, 628]]<|/det|>
Diagram 1 has 3 one centimetre lines.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 625, 435, 643]]<|/det|>
Diagram 2 has 9 one centimetre lines.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 655, 873, 689]]<|/det|>
The formula for the **total** number of one centimetre lines needed to draw **all** of the **first** \(n\) **diagrams** is

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[448, 685, 556, 704]]<|/det|>
\[an^{3} + bn^{2} + n.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 701, 351, 720]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[500, 855, 824, 874]]<|/det|>
<form>Answer(c) $a =$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[583, 887, 824, 906]]<|/det|>
<form>b =
